greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle with T(n,k) = n^2 + k^2.
comment: For any i,j >=0 a(i)*a(j) is a member of this sequence, since (a^2 + b^2)*(c^2 + d^2) = (a*c + b*d)^2 + (a*d - b*c)^2. - _Boris Putievskiy_, May 05 2013
A227481(n) = number of squares in row n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 11 2013
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..120 of triangle, flattened
formula: T(n+1,k+1) = T(n,k) + 2*(n+k+1), k=0..n; T(n+1,0) = T(n,0) + 2*n + 1. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 11 2013
program: a069011_tabl = map snd $ iterate f (1, [0]) where
xref: Cf. A001481 for terms in this sequence, A000161 for number of times each term appears, A048147 for square array.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Apr 02 2002
